intro: Epidendrum yucatanense, commonly known as the Yucatan orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It features a sympodial growth habit with a rhizome that produces multiple stems. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, showy flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. Epidendrum yucatanense thrives in humid, well-drained environments and is often found in forest understories.
